Alas, and did my Saviour bleed?
And did my Sov'reign die?

Would He devote that sacred head
For such a worm as 1?

At the cross, at the cross

Where | first saw the light,

And the burden of my heart
rolled away,

It was there by faith

| received my sight,

And now | am happy all the day!

Was it for crimes that | have done
He groaned up on the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!

Well might the sun in darkness hide,
And shut his glories in,
When Christ the mighty Maker died


For man, His creatureâ€™s sin.

But drops of grief can ne'er repay
The debt of love | owe;

Here, Lord, | give myself away
'Tis all that | can do.

Isaac Watts
